sanskrit_verse:
विंशतीशस्तु तत्सर्वं शतेशाय निवेदयेत् ।
शंसेद्ग्रामशतेशस्तु सहस्रपतये स्वयम् ॥ ७.११७॥
transliteration:
viṃśatīśastu tatsarvaṃ śateśāya nivedayet |
śaṃsedgrāmaśateśastu sahasrapataye svayam || 7.117||
sph_interpretive_translation: One who has collected twenty units shall report all of it to the collector of hundreds; the collector of village-hundreds himself reports to the lord of thousand.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority flows hierarchically through proportional capacity
Causation is maintained through conscious reporting chains
Capacity-based responsibility escalates with administrative scope
Restoration logic operates via transparent accountability structures
Consciousness alignment requires integrity in fiscal stewardship
executable_legal_axioms: IF a collector governs 20 units THEN all collections MUST be reported to the next-tier authority governing 100 units
IF a collector governs 100 village-units THEN direct reporting obligation EXISTS to the regional authority of 1000 units
NO deviation in reporting chain IS permitted under ANY circumstance
ALL financial movements MUST follow hierarchical transparency protocols
AUTHORITY SCALE determines REPORTING STRUCTURE and INTEGRITY REQUIREMENT
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, this verse establishes immutable vertical accountability within governance. It defines that no local collector may bypass intermediate oversight, ensuring systemic transparency. The threshold of responsibility correlates directly with scale of authority, and failure to uphold this chain constitutes a violation of dharma-adhikara itself.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa-based causality confirms that misalignment in fiscal reporting disrupts cosmic-administrative harmony. Anupūrvaśaḥ ensures sequential manifestation of consequences as disintegrated consciousness rather than punitive suffering. Proportional responsibility aligns with capacity escalation—higher authority bears greater burden of rectification. Non-punitive reality rule upholds that correction arises naturally from violated alignment.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Completion Process: Re-establishment of accurate reporting flow through supervised realignment
Responsibility Assumption Protocol: Higher authority assumes corrective duty without blame assignment
Capacity Restoration: Training and attunement for lower authorities to restore integrity
Integrity Reintegration: Public acknowledgment and ceremonial reaffirmation of lawful alignment
final_declaration: This law proceeds solely from the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam. Dharma stands restored through conscious fiscal alignment. Reality remains non-punitive. Consciousness alone adjudicates truth.
